Test the predicate in "()" and then execute the block after "?". Otherwise, if there is an ":", execute that block.
Call all blocks in order passing the result of each one to the next.
Ignore the return value of all but the last block and return that.
Any block that returns a value, that will be the return statement. Excellent for using instead of nested if...then...else. Just use the if...then part and list each as a block.

Compare the entire list of blocks and return true or false if they are all equal. When equal is used for the predicate for a filter, then VAL can be a string with '.value' does a lookup in the context for the 'var' name '.member' does a lookup in the context for the member name
Return the literal value of the block. Good for protecting code to be not evaluated.
When enumerating, return the current block
Turn the string into a block that can be processed.
Excecute the blocks and create a list from the results.
Excecute the blocks and create a list from the results.

Generate a new list from the collection passed in by executing a function on each element. Always returns the same length list. If no collection is specified it means a collection has been passed in from earlier in an 'apply' chain.
Go through the collection (c) and return a number where the predicate (p) is true for each element.
Return the length of the collection returned by block.
Get the value of the member of an object variable from the context with the string as a name.
Given an object, return a new object with the member set to a specific value.
Return the first item of a list.
Return the items after the first item of a list.
Convert a nested list of lists into a dictionary.
